title: Rebekah Vardy mocks own feud with Coleen Rooney as she hails husband for role in Leicester's 9-0 win
text:
Rebekah Vardy amusingly referenced her feud with Coleen Rooney as social media was sent into a frenzy following Leicester's historic 9-0 victory over Southampton.

Leicester humiliated Southampton at St Mary's in the Premier League, with Rebekah's husband, Jamie, scoring the final goal from the penalty spot right at the death to record the biggest ever away win in Premier League history.

And following the final whistle, football fans and clubs went wild on social media after witnessing something remarkable.

Leicester humiliated Southampton 9-0 on Friday night at St Mary's in the Premier League

Jamie Vardy scored Leicester's ninth to record the biggest away win in Premier League history

Rebekah Vardy amusingly referenced her feud with Coleen Rooney on social media on Friday

Immediately after Vardy scored his hat-trick goal from the penalty spot, Rebekah joked on her Twitter page: 'It's...... Jamie Vardy #9.'

Southampton's fierce south coast rivals Portsmouth were quick to aim a jibe at Ralph Hasenhuttl's side: 'Congratulations to @LCFC for equalling the record for biggest Premier League win.'

Sunderland also made light of their 8-0 thrashing at St Mary's back in October 2014, posting an amusing Spider-Man meme.

Leicester's win on Friday was also the joint biggest victory ever in the Premier League. The other was Manchester United's 9-0 romp over Ipswich at Old Trafford back in 1995.

Portsmouth were quick to aim a jibe at their fierce south coast rivals following the humiliation

Sunderland mocked their own 8-0 thrashing at St Mary's from back in October 2014 on Twitter

And Ipswich also poked fun at the scoreline, posting a GIF of Homer Simpson patting the empty seat next to him on the sofa.

Meanwhile, one football fan tweeted: 'This match was like playing beginner in FIFA.'

And finally, another supporter tweeted: 'Harry Maguire left this Leicester team to be in the relegation battle,' alongside three laughing emojis.

Southampton won't be able to forget this performance any time soon and unfortunately for them, it doesn't get any easier.

Their next two games are against English giants Manchester City away in both the Carabao Cup and Premier League.

description: Rebekah Vardy amusingly referenced her feud with Coleen Rooney as social media was sent into a frenzy following Leicester's historic victory over Southampton on Friday night at St Mary's.
